Package cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner

Class DialogCenter

java.lang.Object
cz.cuni.mff.java.flightplanner.DialogCenter
public class DialogCenter
extends java.lang.Object
The DialogCenter class provides the communication interface between the program and its user. This class represents includes also basic methods and functions to handle the initial setting of the program.

  • Method Details

    • welcomeMenu

      static void welcomeMenu()
      The method prints initial welcoming text.

    • chooseOutputForm

      public static java.io.OutputStream chooseOutputForm​(java.lang.String arg, boolean prompt, java.lang.String fileName)
      The method which asks the user to precise the way how the output of the currently performed action should be managed.
      Parameters:
      arg - The optional argument to be printed in the prompted message.
      prompt - Boolean flag which indicates whether the user's interaction is required in the setFileOutputStream(boolean, String) method.
      fileName - The name of a file used in case the output is to be printed to file. If null, then a temporary file is created.
      Returns:
      The value of output stream to be used. For more details, see setFileOutputStream(boolean, String) method.
      See Also:
      setFileOutputStream(boolean, String)

    • setFileOutputStream

      public static java.io.OutputStream setFileOutputStream​(boolean prompt, java.lang.String fileName)
      Sets the output stream chosen by the user and eventually creates the file to be written in. The output file is by default created in the project output directory. However, the user is given the possibility to specify either the absolute or the relative path to the output file. The path and file creation are handled by FilesHandler class.
      Parameters:
      prompt - Boolean flag which indicates whether user's interaction is required.
      fileName - The name of a file used in case the output is to be printed to file. If null, then a temporary file is created.
      Returns:
      The output stream type to be used when printing gathered data.

    • choosePlugins

      static java.util.List<Plugin> choosePlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> modes)
      Launches an interactive mode which makes user choose from available options. These options are printed and then matched using the unique ID numbers.
      Parameters:
      modes - The list of all available plugins.
      Returns:
      Returns the list of the plugins chosen by the user.

    • listAllPlugins

      private static java.lang.String listAllPlugins​(java.util.List<Plugin> plugins)
      Iterates through the list of plugins to help the user identify them by their ID number.
      Parameters:
      plugins - The list of available plugins.
      Returns:
      Returns a string of all provided plugin IDs.

    • getInput

      public static java.lang.String getInput​(boolean blankLineAllowed, boolean printNewLine)
      The method gets the input typed-in by the user.
      Parameters:
      blankLineAllowed - Flag to indicate whether the empty line will be accepted as a correct input.
      printNewLine - Flag which separates the dialog that follows.
      Returns:
      Non-null String input given by a user.

    • getResponse

      public static boolean getResponse​(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String question, java.lang.String trueAnswer, boolean blankAllowed)
      Method prompts a question preceded by an optional message. The user is expected to provide the answer to the question which is then evaluated based on the trueAnswer parameter. In order to evaluate the method as true, both the trueAnswer and the user's actual response have to start with the same letter (comparison is not case-sensitive).
      Parameters:
      message - Optional message to be printed before the question.
      question - The question for the user to be shown on stdout.
      trueAnswer - The required beginning of the response in order to evalute as true.
      blankAllowed - Flag to indicate whether the empty line will be accepted as a correct input.
      Returns:
      True, if the beginnings of both user's answer and trueAnswer parameter are equal.
